alert.note: Alert for Portage; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 6:37PM EDT until September 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Portage and Trumbull. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warren, Newton Falls, Leavittsburg, Bristolville, Windham, Turnpike Interchange, Champion Heights and South Canal. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
